H0.text: A lunar eclipse occurs when a full moon moves through Earthâ€™s shadow.

H1.text: Cycle is the type of eclipse that occurs when a full moon moves through Earth's shadow.

H2.text: Solar is the type of eclipse that occurs when a full moon moves through Earth's shadow.

H3.text: Planetary is the type of eclipse that occurs when a full moon moves through Earth's shadow.

A4.text: A lunar eclipse, also called a blood moon, is an astronomical event that occurs when the Moon orbits through Earth's shadow.

A5.text: During a full moon, the phase during which lunar eclipses take place, the dark side of the Earth is illuminated by the Moon and its moonlight.
